critique: This document establishes the President's Commission on White House Fellowships. It aims to give young people opportunities to observe and participate in government service. It emphasizes selecting individuals with high moral character, leadership potential, and dedication to American institutions. The program is designed to be non-discriminatory. There is nothing particularly liberal or conservative about this. It does not obviously expand executive power. It does not obviously relate to federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It does not obviously relate to immigration.
